author: Diane Hallinen, MD

comments.message: I can see them doing this for some of our military that are likely to get sick and for medical personnel.  We have a tendency to treat them separately already and they wouldn't have to be convinced to go.

Interesting idea, Diane. Do you have any thoughts about how to ensure that this is a medical facility that people would voluntarily go to? Thinking about stigma and fear, I wonder how a ship would be perceived?

description: I imagine transport to the ship would be a logistic challenge. Detailed health history information of health care workers could be obtained ahead of time, including results of recent physicals and lab tests.
summary: During the response to Haiti's earthquake disaster, the USA stationed a hospital boat to care for injured patients. Perhaps a military hospital boat could be retrofitted to care for infected health care workers.  It might help reassure caregivers that there is an ICU waiting for them if they get sick.  I understand the army is building a hospital, but I suspect that will get overrun.
title: Hospital Boat
